newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Timmer to quit Philips supervisory board.
newsitem.headline: Timmer to quit Philips supervisory board.

text.p: Philips Electronics NV said on Tuesday that former executive board chairman Jan Timmer planned to resign from the supervisory board.
"The supervisory board regrets this decision, but respects the personal considerations which have led to his departure," Philips said.
Timmer, who joined the company in 1952, was executive board chairman between July 1990 and October 1996.
He stepped down last year to make way for Cor Boonstra after setting up the Centurion restructuring plan, which is widely acknowledged to have rescued Philips from near-bankruptcy.
The company is expected to report a severe fall in profits when it reports for 1996 on Thursday.
The supervisory board gives the final approval to decisions of the management board, which is involved in the day-to-day running of the company.
A Philips spokesperson could not be contacted for further comment.
